title: Algebra I Regents Examination
driving_question: How can you apply algebraic concepts to solve real-world problems?
background_context: You are about to take part in a simulated version of the Algebra I Regents Examination, an exam administered by the University of the State of New York. This exam tests your understanding of algebraic concepts and their application to real-world scenarios. The exam consists of multiple parts, each containing a variety of questions. You are expected to answer all questions, using the information provided to determine your answers. Graphs and diagrams are a crucial part of the exam, and you should be prepared to utilize them effectively.
tasks: Analyze the data of a ball's height above the ground at different time intervals and draw a valid conclusion.
Formulate a system of inequalities to model a bus company's profit-making scenario.
Use the given formulas and diagrams to answer questions, ensuring to clearly indicate the necessary steps, including appropriate formula substitutions, diagrams, graphs, charts, etc.
pre_thinking_prompts: What algebraic concepts do you think will be most relevant in this exam?
How might you use graphs and diagrams to aid in your problem-solving process?
What strategies will you use to approach multi-step problems?
reflection_prompt: What did you learn about your problem-solving abilities in this exam? What strategies were most effective, and what areas do you need to improve on?
ai_tutor_prompts: Can you explain why you chose that particular approach to solve the problem?
How did you interpret the data or diagram to arrive at your answer?
What other strategies could you have used to solve this problem?
remix_zone: Students could remix this problem by creating their own real-world scenarios that require the application of algebraic concepts. They could then exchange scenarios with classmates to solve.
